remarks: Induction on the upper integers that start at ` M ` .  The first four hypotheses give us the substitution instances we need; the last two are the basis and the induction step.  (Contributed by NM, 5-Jul-2005.)
statement:
uzind.1 $e |- ( j = M -> ( ph <-> ps ) ) $.
uzind.2 $e |- ( j = k -> ( ph <-> ch ) ) $.
uzind.3 $e |- ( j = ( k + 1 ) -> ( ph <-> th ) ) $.
uzind.4 $e |- ( j = N -> ( ph <-> ta ) ) $.
uzind.5 $e |- ( M e. ZZ -> ps ) $.
uzind.6 $e |- ( ( M e. ZZ /\ k e. ZZ /\ M <_ k ) -> ( ch -> th ) ) $.
uzind $p |- ( ( M e. ZZ /\ N e. ZZ /\ M <_ N ) -> ta ) $.
$d M j k $.
$d N j $.
$d ch j $.
$d j ps $.
$d j ta $.
$d j th $.
$d k ph $.
